H5354.def: = to experience a deep loathing for a person or condition

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H4751.def: = a small quantity of a liquid

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H7561.def: = state in which humans are or are considered to be in a state of guilt before God or humans, ◄ as a result of (allegedly) having acted in a way that is contrary to the law

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H7378.def: = action by which humans initiate a possible argument or conflict with other humans or with a deity by accusing them of wrongdoing or by taking action in a different way

H3988.def: = state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events

H3018.def: = action by which humans are engaged in laborious work which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

H3313.def: = process by which a light bearing object gives out or reflects a bright light

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H1245.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H1875.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H7561.def: = state in which humans are or are considered to be in a state of guilt before God or humans, ◄ as a result of (allegedly) having acted in a way that is contrary to the law

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H1104.def: = action by which humans or animals cause food to pass down from their mouth to their esophagus; ≈ often used figuratively to denote destruction and death

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H2563.def: = stiff tenacious earth; ► material of which bricks, pottery, and even man himself is made; ≈ buildings made with this material are regarded as relatively weak as opposed to buildings made of stone; therefore it is also seen as relatively worthless material

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H5413.def: = process by which water flows from heaven in the form of rain

H2461.def: = white fluid; ◄ secreted by women and female mammals; ► for nourishment of their children or young; also used as food for humans; ≈ highly appreciated and considered high quality food; associated with delight, whiteness, purity, wealth, and well-being; metaphor for beauty, young age; quality, wealth, and sex

H1385.def: = a substance made from the pressed curds of milk, starting as a liquid and slowly gaining substance; ► used as food; ≈ used metaphorically to denote the growth of a baby's body in the mother's womb

H3847.def: = state in which humans wear certain clothes, often for a specific purpose

H5785.def: = the thin layer of tissue forming the natural outer covering of the body of a person or animal

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H6106.def: = any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength

H1517.def: = a piece of tough fibrous connecting tissue uniting muscles to bones ► and so forming the inner framework of the body

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H6845.def: = action by which humans hide themselves ► in order to attack another person

H428.def: = marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

H3824.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H5352.def: literally: to be cleaned out; hence: = causative action by which a city is deprived of its inhabitants

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H7561.def: = state in which humans are or are considered to be in a state of guilt before God or humans, ◄ as a result of (allegedly) having acted in a way that is contrary to the law

H6663.def: = state or process by which humans and deities are found to conform to an accepted code of behavior

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H7649.def: = process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

H7036.def: = state which provokes disdain from the general public or from a specific category of people ◄ due to one's behavior or condition

H7202.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H6040.def: literally: to be bowed down; hence: = state in which humans are suffering hardship and trouble and unable to help themselves

H1342.def: = process by which plants and other inanimate objects increase in height

H7826.def: exact meaning unsure; possibly: = male {L:lion<SDBH:אֲרִי>} that is no longer living with its pride and wanders around alone

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H6381.def: = state in which an event is out of the ordinary, inspiring amazement, and usually associated with the supernatural

H2318.def: = causative action by which humans restore an object to make it function again in the way it has functioned before

H5707.def: = a person or deity who has evidence that something has taken place or that some decision has been made

H3708.def: = state in which human experience displeasure, which is said to reside in their {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>} ◄ and is caused by their own condition or by someone else

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H2487.def: = set of inanimate objects that belong together

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H7358.def: = part of the lower body of women and mammals where offspring are conceived and in which they grow until their birth; ≈ sometimes extended to refer to a woman, the time of birth, the place where something is produced, and the innermost part of an area

H1478.def: = process by which a human being breathes his last breath, ◄ either as a result of a natural cause or of an unnatural cause, ► resulting in death

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H2986.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or inanimate objects to move or be moved from one place to another

H990.def: = front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

H6913.def: = place where one or more people are buried, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, stench and decay, uncleanness

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H4592.def: = small quantity of objects or substance

H2308.def: = process by which objects stop existing in this world

H7896.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H1082.def: = process by which a flash of light appears and brightens up the surrounding world; ≈ associated with joy and suddenness

H2962.def: = a marker pointing to the time preceding a particular point in time

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H2822.def: = state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

H6757.def: literally: shadow of death, only found in poetry; hence: = state in which there is a total absence of light ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer to distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, fear, death, and oblivion

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H5890.def: = state of absence of daylight; ≈ associated with death

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H652.def: = state of total absence of light; ≈ associated with suffering and death

H6757.def: literally: shadow of death, only found in poetry; hence: = state in which there is a total absence of light ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer to distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, fear, death, and oblivion

H3313.def: = process by which a light bearing object gives out or reflects a bright light

4.gl: land of only darkness > world of the dead
